list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: When the boy first went to boarding school, he was very homesick.

list_ex_of_english: There are many reasons why boys are not suitable for boarding schools, why the life makes them unhappy, and why boys who have never previously left home are homesick.
He became homesick for wife and family, and his health declined.
I think that it is true that a number of them feel homesick and want to go back.
Other women reported that they were not mature enough to maintain the commitment to their marriage, or they became homesick and ran away from their husband to return home.
Nonah is not only homesick for her coastal homeland, she is also a very shy girl.
The great advantage of having a family unit is that the young migrant does not get homesick after he or she has gone abroad.
If a girl is very unhappy and homesick, it affects her work as well as her health.
Green was homesick, depressed and said he was missing his family.
